text:
Just to play devil’s advocate, “manager” doesn’t have to mean you have people reporting to you. It depends on the company! I am at a startup and we have many content managers/social media managers/etc who have no direct reports. My suggestion would be to use a tool like <http://salary.com|salary.com> to explore some of these titles, read their typical responsibilities and salaries, and choose something that aligns best there.

(Also my two cents: I think strategist feels more senior than specialist, and it does seem like you’re doing strategy!)

text: As a current Content Specialist, I would definitely argue you either are accomplishing strategist, senior, or manager level work. I'd honestly recommend checking out ABM (Account-based marketing) roles because you are performing a lot of tasks that sit within that space
